title: Great app, but the glitch in app selector is an almost dealbreaker.
text: I first used Opal only for the free trial.  The app works great and as intended and helped reduce procrastination during work. However, the app selector continuously crashes, which makes creating screen focus profiles difficult. Additionally, the limited number of apps I can select seems to defeat the purpose.  Why not let the user select as many apps to block as they want?  That being said, I came back to Opal because it was the best app for me. Design is beautiful, just wish there were less glitches in one of the most important parts of the app.

title: The best so far, except
text: I‚Äôve tried several blockers, and this has been the best so far. The only problem is the screen crashing when selecting some categories of apps to block. My main problem is Information & Reading‚Äîbut I would like to enable just one app in the category for a specific purpose in the mornings. But the screen crashes every time I try to expand it. There is a polite apologetic message saying it sometimes happens when the ‚ÄòOther‚Äô category is selected, which is really downplaying the problem. It‚Äôs every single time, with the Information category. I know it‚Äôs a long list but is there really nothing you can do to optimize the screen load?

title: It has been a life changer for me
text: Opal is a massive upgrade of the Apple Screen Time feature. You can do a lot more customization and the different barriers. You can set up really have made a difference for me. After using it for about 10 days, I‚Äôve been averaging almost 3 1/2 hours less a day on my phone. I‚Äôve been much more productive and happier.

title: It works.
text: I‚Äôd spend longer on this review, but Opal has kind of liberated me from doing so much on my phone (that was time flushed down the toilet) that I‚Äôve got better things to do than be on my device now. It‚Äôs a great app.

title: Great!
text: I usually don‚Äôt write reviews but this app deserves one. I always start my day scrolling, my evenings and nights. My average screen time was 6hrs daily and 12hrs weekly. I wanted to stop but had no motivation. Then I saw this app. My screen time changed from 6hrs to 1hr overnight. I was extremely shocked. And the thing I like about it is that normally when your screen time is up, you can press ‚Äúallow all day‚Äù which basically lets you keep scrolling but with this app, if you try to open any app that you blocked after your screen time is over, it wouldn‚Äôt allow you and give you some motivational advice. So yes thank you.

title: Great
text: Great app, annoying bug with the screen crashing when trying to select individual apps for blocking. That‚Äôs the only issue really

title: Best doom scroll solution
text: This app is awesome. The free version helps me be very mindful and intentional about my phone use. I avoid doom scrolling while still having some time to post if I want to. Honestly can‚Äôt believe how great just the free version is!

title: Maybe you‚Äôll read feedback
text: I tried to give feedback on the app but it sent me to the ‚Äúcommunity boards‚Äù. I like the app and it has the potential to be life-changing, seriously. But, two things bread it for me. The games I am addicted to work with streaks, and I would like to customize my ‚Äúwarnings‚Äù  before it shuts down. Or, at least, be able to check what Opal measures as my most recent use. If I made a limit of 45 minutes, play for around 40 minutes before I get off my phone, I should be able to ‚Äútake credit‚Äù for my break leaving the house if o want to, not lose my streak bc I shortly after missed my warning and get kicked out after only 5 minutes. I subscribed with the discount I as offered this year, but would not pay full price because of this gap.

title: Effective, but costly
text: Effective at helping me control my screen time, but the subscription could be much cheaper.

title: My time is back
text: I love the app. Yes there are small things that can be improved. But overall I love how easy is to block the apps that steal your time. We all know we are addicted, Opal makes it easier to remember.

title: Won‚Äôt unblock my apps when I take breaks
text: I‚Äôve had Opal for months and I use this app at the gym to regulate my breaks and until the past few weeks it was great. But recently, when I go to take breaks none of my apps are getting unblocked and it also happens when I try to leave my session. I have it on normal mode so I don‚Äôt know why this is happening. Please fix it!

title: Best social media app blocker for adults
text: As an adult, I realize I am responsible for my attention, but this app gives me one more obstacle blocking me from what I think is the most addictive quality of social media, which is its ease of access.

title: Broken Functionality
text: I loved this app for the time it worked, but it has stopped allowing me to add or change blocked apps and doesn‚Äôt even block the apps it‚Äôs meant to any more.  It‚Äôs essentially a very expensive waste at this point.

title: Effective!
text: This app has helped me immensely cut back on mindless scrolling. I found myself picking up my phone and scrolling way too much without even thinking about it. Opal has helped me be way more mindful with my precious time!

title: Essential App
text: I‚Äôve been able to get more meaningful work done in the last 3 days than I have in the last 3 months with the help of this app!

title: It is really good to help cut your screen time short
text: The experience was nice I got to enjoy more out of life instead of stying home inside watching my phone all day

title: I admitted I was powerless over my phone and my life had become unmanageable.
text: $99 paid for peace. This app works. And it works in a flexible way. I can specifically choose the apps that are a problem and leave the apps that I need for work or that don't really I use in a healthy way. That has changed over time because I found some apps are more problematic than I realized and I added them which was pretty easily done.... On the medium setting I kept ending up back on my phone.  I finally bit the bullet and put it on the hard setting at least or in the morning where I  CAN'T OPEN  selected apps. I maybe needed the medium setting  to prove that I don't have control over my phone use without a hard no.  When I admitted I was powerless over my phone and my life had become unmanageable I was ready to use the app shut down opal can provide and I'm very grateful to this company for creating this really flexible app that allows me to use it and not have to buy a flip phone.

title: Great app, really actually helps
text: I‚Äôm surprised how well it‚Äôs working! Looked at my partner instead of my phone this morning. :) Noticing myself itching for entertainment, and instead spent time browsing my birding ID app which I love. Feels a lot healthier! I want to get a good productivity score for the day and feel like I‚Äôm being held accountable. The app has really nice design and I like how quickly and easily I can block apps. Thank youuu!!!

title: 5 stars. It works. Set the rule and watch it save you from you.
text: 5 stars. It works. Set the rule and watch it save you from you.

title: Quality has tanked
text:
I originally gave opal 5 stars bc I love the UI but over the past 2 weeks it has been bugging out an insane amount to the point where it‚Äôs extremely frustrating to use the app. The countdown timer freezes randomly, many components in the app don‚Äôt even render or freeze, and there‚Äôs sometimes a 30 second delay after taking a break from a block. 

I‚Äôm not sure what changes are causing this but it‚Äôs been very frustrating.

title: get your act together
text: been using this app for years to block IG, Twitter, on Deep Focus mode. Blocking mechanism works great when you can set it up properly, but literally everything else about this app (the clunky emoji-heavy design, the constantly crashing app-selection page, the dropdown menus when selecting apps to block that seem to ‚Äúhide‚Äù behind adjacent categories, the annoying intro clickthrough pages where I have to tell them my age, occupation, etc) it‚Äôs honestly pathetic at this point that they haven‚Äôt fixed it. will be canceling my subscription and looking for alternatives

title: I hate Opal
text: Opal is 100 dollars. ü•∏

title: Have used free version for a year.
text: I love this app. I recommend it to everyone. Its truly helped me cut back on social media and distractions from text messages. Busting an accomplishment gem is so fun, the little inspiration quotes when it blocks you are funny and encouraging. The deep breath you have to do when you have to unblock the app is wonderful and gives you a moment to be in the moment. I know the paid version would be worth it to keep all that data on yourself for improvement but ive been really cutting back on subscriptions. I really appreaciate their free version and i am grateful that they give you enough within the free version to continue to use everyday. Which is why i revommend it to everyone. Thank you Opal.

title: Scam
text:
I think a lot of people don‚Äôt realize that this feature is already built into your phone for free. Go to settings, Screen time, App Limits, then pick the kind of apps you want to block and which days you want them blocked and after how much time on the app. 

Like the ‚Äúinsights‚Äù feature of this app? That‚Äôs also already built into your phone. Also under the screen time settings. 

Like the little virtual rewards you get for being good and not being on your phone? Save the money from not paying for this subscription and buy yourself a real one!

title: Already see a difference
text: I am only a few days into using this app and it is wonderful! My screen time has decreased as promised. I can update later when I‚Äôve gotten further but so far so good!

title: If want to focus, this a good choice!
text: I got this app like a week ago and like I wonder how it‚Äôs going to impact me! Now no more late night visits to Snapchat, insta, or Tik tok! And on the sabbath  I can chill without looking at it for nothing. Highly recommend!

title: Too many bugs
text: If they don‚Äôt fix the bugs soon I will delete the app. It is deeply frustrating to not be able to edit settings because that option just completely disappeared when it used to be there, and for the unblocking not to take place after waiting several times. Before all these issues I thought the app was helpful (free version)

title: Amazing FREE stuff
text: I never write reviews, and my firat thought was, ahh so what I have restriction on my phone, but I downloaded anyway just to see. WOW!! title: This helps me set timers for breaks :)
text: This has been so wonderful!! I can set certain times of day where I usually spend hours scrolling and set those times to be blocked. If I ever want to have 10-15 mins on a certain app, I can go on Opal and ‚ÄúTake a Break‚Äù and set a timer for between 1-15 mins. Then Opal gives a 1 minute warning that my break is about to end before closing off access to that app. I also like the timer you have to wait through to take a break. Sometimes I want to scroll before falling asleep but then after waiting out the 30 second timer I‚Äôm like ‚ÄúI‚Äôm tired I should just sleep‚Äù It‚Äôs very helpful.

title: Actually useful
text:
In a world of subpar apps meant to steal your data, Opal is actually one built properly to help you accelerate your focus during critical times. 

If you need help staying off of distracting apps, Opal is your new best friend.

title: Latest update has broken the app
text: Ever since the update 2 days ago, the app struggles to function properly. While the blocking system still works, the process to pause a block or take a break almost completely stopped working. This was the main reason why I chose this app over others, so look elsewhere if you want a feature like this that is functional.

title: Good App
text:
Good app to help limit screen time. However, the inability to schedule overlapping sessions with varied levels of difficulty makes it not as useful as it could be. I‚Äôd like to have certain times of the day where my social media is in deep focus but work apps are on time out. 

Setting an app limit for the day on some is not a good workaround.

title: Become ‚ÄúHuman‚ÄùAgain!
text: For me personally I noticed I was becoming very isolated from people in general and I know that‚Äôs not how we‚Äôre wired as human beings. I tried the screen app that comes built-in with the iPhone, but the weak barriers would allow me to just continue doom scrolling or watching something that was not gonna benefit me Once I got Opal and became strict with my rules, a forced me to seek other things outside of entertainment throughout my phone and within a week and a half the days feel much longer, my interaction with people are more meaningful, and I am more present than I‚Äôve ever been. If you are somome that would like to tap back into that innate ability to ‚Äúconnect‚Äù with people face to face allow this app to do wonders for youüôå

title: Clearer skies
text: At the time of this review I‚Äôve had opal for a day. It has already done so much for me. I got home from school and turned on a focus session and I got so much done. I made my bed, folded laundry, cleaned my room and finally started playing my app project that I‚Äôve been telling myself to do for so many days. When I stepped outside to take a break the sky looked beautiful and I felt like the world was beautiful again. This app has worked so many wonders in just one day, I can‚Äôt imagine what it will do for the rest of my life.
